EXIT   X

HEALTH AND SAFETY AT WORK

Page

Table of Contents

 

 

In Victoria, issue resolution takes place between employers and employees

When consulting with workers, a PCBU is required to:

 

•

share relevant information

•

give workers a reasonable opportunity to express their views and raise concerns

•

give workers a reasonable opportunity to contribute to the decision-making process

•

take the workers' views into account

•

advise the workers of the outcome of the consultation

 

Click the button below for more information

 

 

A PCBU and workers must make reasonable efforts to resolve WHS issues that occur at the workplace or as a result of the organisation’s conduct. If the parties are unable to resolve an issue, any party may ask the regulator to appoint an inspector to help resolve the issue.
